1.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
1.str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

1.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
1.str2: Probably a fuller form of rheo; an alternate for epo in certain tenses; to utter, i.e. Speak or say.

1.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
1.str2: (a) I remain, tarry, (b) I remain in, persist in. From epi and meno; to stay over, i.e. Remain.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.

1.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
1.str2: From pleion; to do, make or be more, i.e. Increase; by extension, to superabound.

2.parse: Verb - Aorist Optative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
2.str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Adverb from the base of pou; an interrogative particle of manner; in what way?; also as exclamation, how much!

2.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
2.str2: To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.

2.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
2.str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

2.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
2.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
(a) of time: still, yet, even now, (b) of degree: even, further, more, in addition. Perhaps akin to etos; 'yet, ' still.

3.str2: Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.

3.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
3.str2: To do not know, be ignorant of, sometimes with the idea of willful ignorance.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

3.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
3.str2: How much, how great, how many, as great as, as much. By reduplication from hos; as As.

3.str2: Lit: I dip, submerge, but specifically of ceremonial dipping; I baptize.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

4.str2: To bury along with. From sun and thapto; to inter in company with, i.e. to assimilate spiritually.

From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.

4.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
And, even, also, namely.

4.str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Freshness, newness, novelty. From kainos; renewal.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.

If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

21.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
21.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

21.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Neuter Plural
Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
21.str2: To be ashamed, be ashamed of. From epi and aischunomai; to feel shame for something.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) an end, (b) event or issue, (c) the principal end, aim, purpose, (d) a tax.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.

22.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
A prolonged form of nun for emphasis; just now.

22.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
22.str2: To free, set free, liberate. From eleutheros; to liberate, i.e. to exempt.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

22.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
22.str2: To enslave. From doulos; to enslave.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from the base of harpazo; fruit, literally or figuratively.

22.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
22.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From hagiazo; properly, purification, i.e. purity; concretely a purifier.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) an end, (b) event or issue, (c) the principal end, aim, purpose, (d) a tax.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.

23.str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of the same as opsarion; rations for a soldier, i.e. his stipend or pay.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From charizomai; a gratuity, i.e. Deliverance;, a endowment, i.e. religious qualification, or miraculous faculty.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

23.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
23.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
